results.title: Goggles!
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel and Isa Wickenhagen
results.brief_description: Peter finds a pair of motorcycle goggles without lenses. He and Archie set off with their treasure but run into some big boys who demand the goggles. Suspense mounts as Peter and Archie, with the help of Peter’s loyal daschund, Willie, attempt to outwit the bullies. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats.

results.title: Goering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Goering’s life story. The air race of 1918; exile in Sweden; return to Germany and the early days of Nazism; Goering sets up the storm troops, the Gestapo, the Luftwaffe, is largely responsible for the economic revival of Germany and wins immense popular prestige. Early Luftwaffe triumphs are eclipsed by the failure of operation Sea Lion and the RAAF raids on Germany. Goering falls from power and public prestige to a figurehead. His capture, trial and sentence at Nuremberg.

results.title: Godzilla: king of the monsters
results.creator_credit: Galaxy Films, Tomoyuki Tanaka, Ishiro Honda and Terry Morse
results.brief_description: Nuclear weapon testing resurrects a relic from the Jurassic age, Godzilla, and the creature is heading for Japan. This is the story that American reporter Steve Martin (Raymond Burr), is investigating. He is hot on the trail of a series of mysterious disasters off the coast of Japan, which leads him to Godzilla. Godzilla wreaks havoc over Tokyo nights, leaving death and destruction in its wake. Dr Serizawa discovers a weapon that will mean the end of Godzilla, but Japan will have to pay a high price; the annihilation of Tokyo Bay. Originally released in Japan as ‘Gojira’ (1954), this version inserted scenes with Raymond Burr. Based on the long running series created by Inoshiro Honda.

results.title: Godzilla
results.creator_credit: Centropolis Pictures, Dean Devlin and Roland Emmerich
results.brief_description: Perhaps one of the world’s most famous and enduring characters, Godzilla first appeared on Japanese screens in the 1954 release “Gojira”. In this version, the monster lizard has been created on a remote island somewhere in the South Pacific by nuclear testing, and she is heading to America, land of plenty, to hatch her offspring. Fantastic special effects make this the ultimate monster movie - a 20 story tall lizard with one thing on her mind.

results.title: Gods and monsters
results.creator_credit: Gregg Fienberg, Mark R. Harris, Bill Condon, Flashpoint Pictures, BBC Film Unit, Regent Entertainment and Paul Colichman
results.brief_description: Gods and Monsters is a biography of film director James Whale who created one of the screen’s great mythic heroes in the classic version of “Frankenstein”. Beginning in the 1950s when Whale (Ian McKellen) is largely forgotten or only remembered through camp nostalgia, the film traces Whale’s increasing obsession with his gardener, Clayton (Brendan Fraser). As Whale’s health deteriorates, his memory increasingly draws him back to the pivotal moments of his life: his rejection of his harsh working-class youth; his service in World War I and his loving affair with a fellow soldier; and his years directing in the classic Hollywood era. Combining biography and a mature examination of the possible love between homosexual and heterosexual men, “Gods and Monsters” ends up being a loving tribute to both the classic Hollywood era and the possibility of transcendence for working-class people. Based on the book “Father of Frankenstein” by Christopher Bram. Cast includes Ian McKellen, Brendan Fraser and Lynn Redgrave. (Awards: Winner of the 1998 Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay)

results.title: Goddess remembered
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Magaret Pettigrew and Donna Read
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This stunning and poetic documentary is a salute to 35,000 years of pre-history, to the solid values of ancestors only recently remembered, and to our ancient goddess-worshipping religions. Archaeologists and anthropologists are beginning to discover evidence of a widespread early civilisation based primarily on human co-operation. This epsiode reveals these forgotten cultures - taking us from ancient caves in France to the sun-drenched palaces at Delphi and Crete. There is also a discussion among well-known scholars such as Merlin Stone and Jean Bolen, who propose a return to a belief in an interconnected life system, with respect for the earth and the female.

results.title: Godavari
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, Jehangir Bhownagary and R.S. Junnerker
results.brief_description: A description of the River Godavari which flows from the hills east of Bombay across northern India to the Bay of Bengal. Includes an account of various temples, shrines, towns and villages built at its source and along its banks.

results.title: Godard 80
results.brief_description: The famous French director Jean-Luc Godard is interviewed by British film theorist Peter Wollen and the editor of “Framework”, Don Ranveaud. He talks of the developments in his work, the change in style epitomised by his most recent film “Sauve Qui Peut”, his work with Francis Ford Coppola and the relationships between his previous films and the new one. He also discusses his radical method of scriptwriting and the critical responses to his latest film.
